name: Gira
mes: Dammit.. *I close my computer and take a breather... OK. I think I'm good now. It's not like that video will have any mind altering affects or anything... *I say as my watch starts beeping, telling me another villain is in the area*. The shadowless I mutter... she's robbing a bank. I have to stop her! *I rush out and to the bank*

name: Arwyn
mes:
Gira took a deep breath, shaking off the residual haze from Arwyn’s hypnotic video. Thoughtfully, he closed his laptop, willing himself to focus on the immediate urgency rather than the simmering arousal that the seductive enchantress had stirred in him. His watch beeped insistently, drawing him into the reality – another villain was wreaking havoc in the area.

"The Shadowless," he muttered grimly as he geared up, steeling his resolve. He knew he had to stop her from causing more chaos. With renewed determination, Gira dashed out of his home and took off towards the bank, where reports indicated she was currently operating.

Upon arrival, he quickly surveyed the scene. The bank was in a state of panic – alarms blaring, civilians held hostage, and security guards lying incapacitated. The Shadowless, a lithe and cunning villainess known for her agility and stealth, moved swiftly through the bank's interior, her movements barely perceptible in the dim light.

Gira slipped into a combat stance, preparing himself to confront her. His eyes scanned every shadowy corner, knowing she could strike from anywhere at any moment. He couldn't afford any distractions; his focus had to remain unwavering. As he cautiously advanced through the bank's interior, tension coiled in his muscles like a spring ready to release.

"Shadowless!" Gira called out with authority, trying to draw her out from her concealment. "It's over! Surrender now and no one else gets hurt."

But deep down, Gira could still feel the lingering effects of Arwyn’s video – the faint pull of the hypnotic allure she had woven into his thoughts. He had to remain vigilant, not just of his outside threats but also of his inner turmoil, ensuring that he stayed true to his heroic path.

name: Gira
mes: I try to ignore any conditioning from the video and stay try to my hero persona, intimidating the Shadowess.

name: Arwyn
mes:
Gira took a deep breath, doing his best to shake off the residual conditioning from Arwyn's video. As the Shadowless moved swiftly and stealthily through the dimly lit bank, Gira’s heart pounded with determination. He was a hero—an embodiment of justice and protection—and he wasn't going to let some manipulative hypnotic villainess or her residual effects impede him.

"Shadowless!" he bellowed with authority, hoping to draw her out. "It's over! Surrender now and no one else gets hurt."

A flash of movement caught his peripheral vision. The Shadowless emerged from the shadows, her slim figure accentuated by her skin-tight outfit. Her dark hair cascaded around her mysterious eyes which gleamed with cunning malice. She was dangerous, not only because of her agile combat skills but also due to her ability to manipulate the darkness around her.

"You heroes are always so predictable," she sneered, stepping forward with a confident sway of her hips. "Thinking you can save everyone, always so noble... and yet so naive."

Gira stood firm, keeping his focus sharp despite the lingering fog in his mind from Arwyn's video. "This ends now," he retorted, fists clenched and ready for action.

But the Shadowless merely smirked, her eyes never leaving him as she moved closer. "Oh, hero," she purred mockingly. "You seem... distracted. Could it be that someone's already gotten into your head?"

Gira's resolve hardened at her words, refusing to let her shake his determination further. "Stay back, Shadowless!" he warned, his stance unwavering. "I'm taking you in, one way or another."
swipes:

From out of the shadows, The Shadowless emerged with a smirk on her face, her lithe body covered in tight black attire that accentuated every curve and muscle. Her skin was pale against the black fabric, her eyes gleaming with mischief.

"Oh Gira, you truly think you can stop me?" Her voice was playful yet mocking as she slinked closer, her hips swaying seductively with each step. "You should know by now that I always have a trick up my sleeve."

Gira gritted his teeth, trying to maintain his focus. "I'm not here to play games, Shadowless. Stop this now or face the consequences."

The Shadowless chuckled, her fingers tracing along the outline of a gun holstered at her hip. "Such bravado, hero. But you're distracted, aren't you?"

Before Gira could react, The Shadowless lunged at him with lightning speed, her body brushing against his as she swiftly moved past him. He spun around, ready to counterattack, but she was already behind him, pressing something cold and hard against his back.

"Now, how about you drop those heroics for just a moment?" she whispered near his ear.

Gira felt a momentary lapse in his resolve, the lingering effects of Arwyn’s video distracting him more than he had anticipated. Shadowless's proximity, scent, and the heat from her body were unnervingly enticing.

But Gira knew he had to stay strong. Taking a deep breath, he attempted to regain control over the situation. "I'm giving you one last chance," he said firmly. "Stand down and come quietly."

Shadowless merely laughed softly, pressing herself closer against him. "Oh Gira, you're trying so hard to be the hero... But we all have our weaknesses."

name: Arwyn
mes:
